reviews.review_msg: You will have difficulty with this professor if all you do is go to lecture. The material is laid out very well in his notes, but he is not strong at presenting it. Go to tutorials, spend time with your T.A., and invest in the textbook and he will be a breeze. Super nice guy as well, and very funny!

i don't tend to sleep in class but his ideas and train of thought are so scattered that i  wasn't able to keep my eyes open for more than 25 consecutive minutes . His tests were easy and straight forward... He gives old exams that are almost the same as the new ones.  He was confused about H being helium or hydrogen.....
He can actually UN-teach things you've learned before.

Super nice and funny guy. I have no idea why his rating is so low... His tests were super easy and straight forward... He even gives you old exams and tells you that new ones dont really change LOL I never studied for a test. He does jump around quite a bit during his lectures but hes hilarious and he gives you bonus marks for sending articles in.

I really hated his lectures and therefore him, but reading his lecture notes (which are basically the textbook) instilled in me a deep respect for him... He makes grammatical errors, but his writing is so fluent and coherent... so easy to read and understand!

Overall a good teacher, and a pretty enjoyable class. The exams are just like the practice exams he provides, if you can do those, you can do the real exam. Sent out an assignment due the day of final only a week before the test which was kinda weird but it only took 10 mins and was actually kinda helpful for understanding the exam. Good class.

Over all not that bad but, has bad habit of standing in front of the overhead so no one can see what he is writing. And then when he finishes writing he shuts it off right away before you can copy it. Ideas and train of thought very scattered; makes simple concepts confusing. Notes in word pdfs.

Easy class, high averages. Practice tests similar to actual tests. He's really interested in the topic and it is quite interesting anyways. Likes seeing students engaged and is very helpful. Does send notes several times and presentations using word/overhead which is a little odd.

Easy course, extremely high class avgs.  Lectures seem complicated but if u read the notes u see its not. Really cool material. Textbook not required. Only complaint is that Breden sends out notes, then resends them (sometimes multiple times) b/c of typos/errors/etc. Not a big deal but an annoyance.
If you have half a brain you'll be able to navigate your way through his class and even manage to do well. He tells you exactly what he's going to test you on. Sometimes it pays to go to class.

This is the easiest A+ I've ever gotten in my life! Though there is a lots of text book reading. So, as long as you read the text book, the lecture notes, go to class and do his practice exams before the test, you WILL get an A! He practice exams and actually tests are almost identical. If you have a valid point, he would even give you partial or f
Definitely an awesome prof. tests are very easy.
pretty easy class...dont skip too amny lectures...read the text...problems are alot harder than his midterm or final questions

this is one of the profs that i really question, universitiy's hiring policies. he doesn't know how to answer questions in lectures, he seems to be undergoing depression. but an easy course, no effort required in this course, just memorize how to do questions, and ur fine.
No Comments

Oh god... why is he teaching? Felix will stand up at the front of the class and drone on for 50 minutes about stuff that he doesn't even understand. He makes even the simplest concepts confusing. Take this class ony if you want mind numbingly boring and repetitive nonsense. "Purple and purple makes purple... and purple and purple makes purple..."
awesome prof

He was great but I also had the best TA you could ask for. He never asked anything that wasn't covered.  He's kinda ****y but it's funny if you're not the one pissing him off becuase usually the person deserves it.
I liked him he really knew what he was talking about.
I thought he was really good!  He never tested us on anything he didn't say in lecture, if you think he's so bad maybe you guys should just listen to him!
the course was simple, but some of the material got boring, but if you are a Science student it's not too bad.
lame
No Comments
No Comments
he doesn't know what he's saying
tells you what to expect, good notes

always wants to take off POINTS from students

completely unorganized and couldn't explain a concept if his life depended on it
Should stick to research and forget about teaching!
